articles.author: Robby Berman
articles.title: Is exercise more effective than medication for depression and anxiety? - Medical News Today
articles.description: Exercise is 1.5 times better at reducing depression, anxiety, and other mental health disorders than psychotherapy or medication, a new study indicates.
articles.content:
• A large new analysis of meta-studies finds that exercise is more beneficial for conditions such as anxiety and depression than standard psychotherapy or medications.
